info.name: SAPECC_GetShippingEvents_Sagar_Completely Automated - LATEST
info.description:
# _**HOW TO USE: - PLEASE REFER BELOW INSTRUCTIONS**_

#### _In the_ _**Collection Variables**_ _section, update the following:_

1. **Environment** ‚Äì Enter the target environment  
    (e.g., DEV2, DEV7, QLAB02, etc.) ‚Äì _case insensitive_.
    
2. **ESP** ‚Äì Enter the ESP detail (e.g., QLAB02, QLAB03, etc.). ‚Äì _case insensitive_.
    
3. **RESOURCE_EXT_ENV** ‚Äì **Optional:**
    
    1. Leave blank to default to the selected Environment.
        
    2. Or specify a different environment if needed (e.g., DEV2, DEV7, QLAB02, etc.).
        
4. **OrderID** ‚Äì Enter the specific Order ID you want to test.
    
5. **EID_List** (non-mandatory) - This can be changed if required but make sure to give in same Array format as shown in example below with any number of EIDs. \["89049032005001111110000005878097","89049032005001111110000005877418"\]
    
6. **TAC_Codes (**non-mandatory) - This is required to generate IMEIs for ESIM and Device with no Plan orders. You can change only if required or leave as is but make sure to give in same Array format as shown in example below with any number of TAC Codes.  
    \["35077773", "35487650"\]
    
7. **Delay (**non-mandatory) - This is a delay set before triggering each request, can be modified as per requirement.
    
8. **password** - As part of password rotation this field has to be updated each time the password is changed.
    

##### Only update non-mandatory variables if your test case demands it; otherwise, they can be left at their default values.

#### _Once variables are set as per your requirement:_

- Click on Activation / Return.
    
- Simply run the collection.
    
- No need to uncheck any request or modify variables unless explicitly needed for your scenario.

exec: console.error("‚ùå OrderId or ESP is missing.");
console.error(`‚ùå Request failed for ${eventName}:`, err || "No response");
console.error(`‚ùå Failed to parse response for ${eventName}: ${e.message}`);
console.log("‚úÖ All DeepIO events returned OK. Proceeding with collection.");
console.warn(`‚ö†Ô∏è Retry ${retryCount}/${maxRetries} in 10 seconds due to failures: ${failedEvents.join(", ")}`);
console.error(`‚ùå Max retries reached. Failed events: ${failedEvents.join(", ")}`);
// 1. Fetch ShiptoOrder Placed event from DEEPIO and stores it, if event fails retries for 10 times at 10 secs delay
// 2. Extracts all the order details and stores to variables
// 3. Runs getOrderDetails request and stores the Response in a variable
// ‚úÖ Always initialize to 0 if not present or reset for fresh run
throw new Error("Payload missing in response");
pm.environment.unset("ShipToRetryCount"); // Reset retry count on success
console.log("‚úÖ Success - Converted Payload JSON:", payloadJson);
return; // Skip normal flow for special SKU
// ‚úÖ Only store normal product if type is allowed
console.error("‚ùå No OrderId found in collection variables");
console.log(`‚úÖ SOAP Response Success ‚Äî Status Code: ${res.code}`);
console.error(`‚ùå responseStatus code is not 100, it is: ${statusCode}`);
console.warn("‚ö†Ô∏è Could not find responseStatus code in response body.");
// -- 1. Set the current date and time in ISO 8601 format as environment variables.
// -- 2. Set the JSON and XML environment variables based on the value of the "Environment" collection variable.
// Get current UTC date and time
// Format 2: ISO 8601 with milliseconds (default format from toISOString)
console.log(`‚ö†Ô∏è No mapping defined for Environment: ${env}`);
pm.environment.set("JSONENV", jsonEnv);  // ‚úÖ Set as environment variable
pm.environment.set("XMLENV", xmlEnv);    // ‚úÖ Set as environment variable
console.log("‚ö†Ô∏è Environment variable is not set in collection variables.");
// 1. Extracts the OrderAccepted Event and parses as required
// 2. Generates IMEIs for Device_ESIM & standalone Device_noPlan
console.log("‚úÖ Successfully parsed and stored OrderAccepted payload:");
console.error("‚ùå Max retries reached. Stopping retries.");
// === Generate IMEIs for Device_ESIM & standalone Device_noPlan ===
// ‚úÖ 1Ô∏è‚É£ Get TAC pool from Collection Variable
throw new Error("‚ùå Missing TAC_Codes in collection variables!");
throw new Error("‚ùå TAC_Codes is empty or invalid!");
// ‚úÖ 2Ô∏è‚É£ Utility: Random TAC & Serial + Luhn check digit
// ‚úÖ Detect USKU ‚Üí covered by SIM ‚Üí skip generation for them
console.log(`üîó USKU: Device${dev.index}_noplan covered by SIM MSISDN ${dev.msisdn} ‚Üí uses SIM resource IMEI`);
const imei1 = tac1 + serial1 + calculateLuhn(tac1 + serial1);
const imei2 = tac2 + serial2 + calculateLuhn(tac2 + serial2);
const imei = tac + serial + calculateLuhn(tac + serial);
console.log(`‚ÑπÔ∏è Device${i}_noplan ‚Üí covered by USKU, uses SIM resource IMEI ‚Üí no local generation.`);
// 1. From getOrderDetails Response below script will fetch all the required SIM type combinations for all the Product list
// 2. Decides How many PSIM / ESIM / Device with No plan and Accessory present in Order
// ‚úÖ USKU: check SIM sibling with same MSISDN
console.log(`üîó USKU (MSISDN match) ‚Üí Device${i} & SIM${j} share MSISDN ${msisdn}`);
console.warn(`‚ö†Ô∏è Could not find orderLine for Device${i}`);
console.log("‚úÖ SIM Type detection done! (Safe sibling matching)");
// ‚úÖ Unique counter name to avoid conflicts
console.log(`üî¢ Total products found for resource count: ${resourceProductCounter}`);
let uskuCoveredDeviceNoPlans = new Set(); // to track which Device_noPlans are covered by SIMs
// ‚úÖ Check which Device_noPlans are covered by SIMs (USKU)
console.log(`üîó USKU: Device${dev.index}_noPlan covered by SIM with same MSISDN ${dev.msisdn}`);
// SIMs + Device_PSIMs + Device_noPlan not covered by USKU SIM
// ‚úÖ IMEIs: only for Device_ESIMs (2 per device)
console.log(`‚úÖ Total IMEIs to generate: ${imeisToGenerate} (EIDs provided externally)`);
// Set the delay before sending the request
console.log(`‚è≥ Waiting for ${delay / 1000} seconds before sending the request...`);
console.log(`‚è≥ Waiting for ${delay / 1000} seconds before sending the request...`);
// 1. Sets Delay if specified in Collection Variable
// 2. Checks if there are any Device_ESIM products
// 3. If no Device_ESIM products, skips to OrderShipped request
// 4. Resources are extracted and stored accordingly
console.log(`‚è≥ Waiting for ${delay / 1000} seconds before proceeding...`);
// ‚úÖ Check if there are any Device_ESIM products
console.warn("‚è≠Ô∏è No Device_ESIM products found ‚Üí skipping ReserveSIM, jumping to OrderShipped next.");
// ‚úÖ 1Ô∏è‚É£ Resource quantity ‚Üí set this yourself before
console.log("‚è≠Ô∏è Resource quantity is zero ‚Üí skipping extraction and continuing.");
return; // ‚úÖ Skip extraction, continue with request flow
pm.sendRequest({ url: resourceURL, method: 'GET' }, function (err, res) {
console.error("‚ùå Resource request failed or empty response.");
// ‚úÖ 3Ô∏è‚É£ Build USKU pairs: SIM + Device_noplan with same MSISDN
console.log(`üîó USKU: Device${j}_noplan paired with SIM${i} (MSISDN: ${simMsisdn})`);
// ‚úÖ 4Ô∏è‚É£ Build resourceConsumers (PSIMs & SIMs, skip ESIM/Accessory & covered noPlans)
console.error(`‚ùå Resource mismatch: expected ${resourceQuantity}, got only ${assignedCount}`);
// ‚úÖ USKU: If this SIM covers a Device_noplan, assign IMEI & IMSI there too
console.log(`‚úÖ Resource extraction done. Assigned ${assignedCount} of ${resourceQuantity}`);
// -- 1. Check if there are any ESIM products in the order
// -- 2. If there are, select one ESIM product and assign an EID to it
// -- 3. If there are no ESIM products, skip the ReserveSIM step and move to the next request
// ‚úÖ Count how many products we have
console.warn("‚è≠Ô∏è No Device_ESIM products found ‚Üí Skipping ReserveSIM step.");
// ‚úÖ Skip ReserveSIM and move to next request
console.log(`üî¢ ReserveSIM for Device_ESIM index ${currentDeviceIndex} (${currentIndex} of ${totalDevices})`);
if (!eidMasterRaw) throw new Error("‚ùå Missing EID_List in collection variables.");
if (!eidArray.length) throw new Error("‚ùå EID list empty.");
// ‚úÖ Clear retry counter if new device
//This script is only for TAG AUTH TOKEN
const isAuthenticationRequired = true; //if you don't need it then make is false
var token_env = 'qlab02'; // dev01 | dit01 | qlab02 | plab01 | prod
//if it is true , then it will add some headers automatically service-transaction-id, sender_id, channel_id, application_id and Content-Type='application/json' with the below values .
//Restricted Area Beyond this point , Do not scroll
//Encoding Base64 of username and password to get Basic Token
{ throw new Error(`Check Your VPN Connection or URL ${tokenUrl} not able to connect`);  }
{ throw new Error(`Auth Token Error: Not able to connect to ${err.hostname}`); }
throw new Error("Auth Token Error: Connect SDP Appgate or Check Console Logs. , open console by CTRL+ALT+C");
{throw new Error("username/password for Auth Token are incorrect.");}
{throw new Error(`Auth Token Error: Issue with Token URL : ${tokenUrl}`);}
throw new Error("Auth Token Error: Check Console Logs. , open console by CTRL+ALT+C");
// ‚úÖ If resourceStatus is not 'AA', retry up to 20 times
// ‚úÖ If resourceStatus is 'AA', store serialNumber and imsi
// ‚úÖ If Product 1 is ESIM ‚Üí mark as firstSimLineImsi
// ‚úÖ Continue to next Device_ESIM if any
// ‚úÖ If all Device_ESIMs done, unset environment variables
console.log(`‚è≥ Device${currentDeviceIndex}_ESIM: Waiting for AA. Retry #${retryCount + 1}`);
throw new Error(`ReserveSIM failed for Device${currentDeviceIndex}_ESIM after 20 retries.`);
// ‚úÖ Continue to next Device_ESIM if any
// 1. Resource Extraction and is done, later carefully assigned each resource to specific product
// 3. line Item block is generated as per the product and passed to the request.
console.log(`‚è≥ Waiting for ${delay / 1000} seconds before sending the request...`);
// === Generate lineItem array ONLY (no extra wrapper) ===
// For Accessory: no IMEI/SIM ‚Äî but keep sequenceNo + orderDetailID only
console.log("‚úÖ Final generatedLineItems array saved ‚Üí Accessory logic: IMEI/SIM skipped except for sequenceNo+orderDetailID, no msisdn.");
// 3Ô∏è‚É£ Add SpecialSku blocks if they exist
console.log("‚úÖ Final generatedSkuBlocks array saved ‚Üí includes standard & SpecialSku items.");
console.log(`‚è≥ Waiting for ${delay / 1000} seconds before sending the request...`);
// === Check if only Accessories are in the order ===
break; // no need to check further
console.log("üì¶ Only Accessories in order ‚Äî skipping OrderDelivered & FirstIMEI.");
pm.execution.setNextRequest("5. OrderDelivered"); // ‚úÖ Continue with next request
console.log(`‚è≥ Waiting for ${delay / 1000} seconds before sending the request...`);

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:v1="http://services.tmobile.com/OrderManagement/EventWSIL/V1" xmlns:base="http://services.tmobile.com/base">
   <soapenv:Body>
      <v1:notifyIncomingEventRequest serviceTransactionId="{{eventId}}" version="">
         <base:header>
            <base:sender>
               <base:senderId>10</base:senderId>
               <base:channelId>10</base:channelId>
               <base:applicationId>SAP</base:applicationId>
               <base:applicationUserId>JOHND</base:applicationUserId>
            </base:sender>
         </base:header>
         <v1:event eventId="78934578935">
            <v1:eventType>OrderDelivered</v1:eventType>
            <v1:eventTime>{{currentDateTime2}}</v1:eventTime>
         </v1:event>
         <v1:orderPayload orderId="{{OrderId}}">
            <!--The Shipping Information. The id is the tracking number-->
            <v1:shipping id="HKFJ68H6S5FKFH77">
               <v1:freightCarrier>FEDEX</v1:freightCarrier>
               <v1:shipFrom>
                  <v1:websiteCommunication>
                     <v1:websiteURI>https:www.fedex.com/track.jsp?id=HKFJ68H6S5FKFH77</v1:websiteURI>
                  </v1:websiteCommunication>
               </v1:shipFrom>
               <v1:note>
                  <v1:noteType>deliveryNumber</v1:noteType>
                  <v1:content>789345789345</v1:content>
               </v1:note>
               <v1:actualDeliveryTime>{{currentDateTime2}}</v1:actualDeliveryTime>
            </v1:shipping>
            <v1:orderAttachment>
               <v1:signatureRequiredIndicator>true</v1:signatureRequiredIndicator>
            </v1:orderAttachment>
            <v1:lastUpdateDate>{{currentDateTime2}}</v1:lastUpdateDate>
         </v1:orderPayload>
      </v1:notifyIncomingEventRequest>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

exec: console.log(`‚è≥ Waiting for ${delay / 1000} seconds before sending the request...`);
// Step 1: Parse the response body to get the JSON object
// Step 2: Extract the 'payload' string from the response
// Step 3: Convert the 'payload' string to a JSON object

// Step 5: Log the converted payload to the console
console.log("Converted Payload JSON from OrderAccepted:", payloadJson);
console.log(`‚ö†Ô∏è No mapping defined for Environment: ${env}`);
pm.environment.set("JSONENV", jsonEnv);  // ‚úÖ Set as environment variable
pm.environment.set("XMLENV", xmlEnv);    // ‚úÖ Set as environment variable
console.log("‚ö†Ô∏è Environment variable is not set in collection variables.");
console.log(`‚è≥ Waiting for ${delay / 1000} seconds before sending the request...`);
// ‚úÖ Extract the payload JSON string and parse it
// ‚úÖ Loop through the returnItemList and extract IMEI, SKU, Description
// ‚úÖ Store IMEI, SKU, Description as imei1, sku1, desc1, imei2, sku2, desc2, ...
console.error("‚ùå No OrderId found ‚Äî stopping run.");
console.log(`‚úÖ SOAP Response received ‚Äî Status Code: ${res.code}`);
// ‚úÖ Store full raw for later parsing
console.error(`‚ùå Invalid responseStatus: ${statusMatch ? statusMatch[1] : "Not Found"}. Stopping run.`);
// Get current UTC date and time
// Format 2: ISO 8601 with milliseconds (default format from toISOString)
console.log(`‚ö†Ô∏è No mapping defined for Environment: ${env}`);
pm.environment.set("JSONENV", jsonEnv);  // ‚úÖ Set as environment variable
pm.environment.set("XMLENV", xmlEnv);    // ‚úÖ Set as environment variable
console.log("‚ö†Ô∏è Environment variable is not set in collection variables.");
console.warn("‚ö†Ô∏è supplyChainOrderId not found in payload.");
// 2Ô∏è‚É£ Regex to find all REMOVE orderLines
let matchCounter = 0; // Count how many REMOVE lines found
// 3Ô∏è‚É£ Match ANY <pfx:orderPayment> block ‚Äî paymentId may or may not be present
// 2Ô∏è‚É£ Always find the first <pfx:orderPayment> with a paymentId
console.warn("‚ö†Ô∏è No paymentId found on any <pfx:orderPayment>.");
console.warn("‚ö†Ô∏è No <pfx:authorizationAmount> found in ADD block.");
console.warn("‚ö†Ô∏è No <pfx:orderPayment actionCode='ADD'> found to extract authorizationAmount.");
console.log(`‚è≥ Waiting for ${delay / 1000} seconds before sending the request...`);
if (!sku) continue; // Skip if no SKU ‚Äî not a valid device
console.error("‚ùå Error in generating order line XML:", error);

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:v1="http://services.tmobile.com/OrderManagement/EventWSIL/V1" xmlns:base="http://services.tmobile.com/base">
   <soapenv:Body>
      <v1:notifyIncomingEventRequest serviceTransactionId="" version="">
         <base:header>
            <base:sender>
               <base:senderId>10</base:senderId>
               <base:channelId>10</base:channelId>
               <base:applicationId>SAP</base:applicationId>
               <base:applicationUserId>SMNAIK1</base:applicationUserId>
            </base:sender>
         </base:header>
         <v1:event eventId="78934578935">
            <v1:eventType>ShipToOrderPlaced</v1:eventType>
            <v1:eventTime>{{currentDateTime2}}</v1:eventTime>
         </v1:event>
         <v1:orderPayload orderId="{{OrderId}}">
            <v1:key>
               <v1:keyName>sapOrderId</v1:keyName>
               <v1:keyValue>{{SAPOrderID_Return}}</v1:keyValue>
            </v1:key>
            <v1:shipping id="HKFJ68H6S5FKFH77">
               <v1:freightCarrier>FEDEX</v1:freightCarrier>
               <!--The Estimated Shipping Date From. If dates are blank/null or not populated from source, this will be treated as BackOrder-->
               <v1:requestedShipTime>2001-12-25T12:00:00</v1:requestedShipTime>
               <!--The Estimated Shipping Date To. If dates are blank/null or not populated from source, this will be treated as BackOrder-->
               <v1:requestedDeliveryTime>2001-12-31T12:00:00</v1:requestedDeliveryTime>
               <v1:note>
                  <v1:noteType>deliveryNumber</v1:noteType>
                  <v1:content>789345789345</v1:content>
               </v1:note>
               <v1:serviceLevelCode>2ND DAY</v1:serviceLevelCode>
            </v1:shipping>
            {{OrderLineList}}
         </v1:orderPayload>
      </v1:notifyIncomingEventRequest>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

console.error("‚ùå Error building order line blocks:", error);

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:v1="http://services.tmobile.com/OrderManagement/EventWSIL/V1" xmlns:base="http://services.tmobile.com/base">
   <soapenv:Body>
      <v1:notifyIncomingEventRequest serviceTransactionId="" version="">
         <base:header>
            <base:sender>
               <base:senderId>10</base:senderId>
               <base:channelId>10</base:channelId>
               <base:applicationId>SAP</base:applicationId>
               <base:applicationUserId>SMNAIK1</base:applicationUserId>
            </base:sender>
         </base:header>
         <v1:event eventId="78934578935">
            <v1:eventType>ReturnReceived</v1:eventType>
            <v1:eventTime>{{currentDateTime2}}</v1:eventTime>
         </v1:event>
         <v1:orderPayload orderId="{{OrderId}}">
         <v1:key>
               <v1:keyName>sapOrderId</v1:keyName>
               <v1:keyValue>{{SAPOrderID_Return}}</v1:keyValue>
            </v1:key>
            <!--The Shipping Information. The id is the tracking number-->
            <v1:shipping>
               <v1:actualDeliveryTime>{{currentDateTime2}}</v1:actualDeliveryTime>
            </v1:shipping>
            {{GeneratedOrderLineBlock}}
         </v1:orderPayload>
      </v1:notifyIncomingEventRequest>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:v1="http://services.tmobile.com/OrderManagement/EventWSIL/V1" xmlns:base="http://services.tmobile.com/base">
   <soapenv:Body>
      <v1:notifyIncomingEventRequest serviceTransactionId="57657576576576576576" version="">
         <base:header>
            <base:sender>
               <base:senderId>10</base:senderId>
               <base:channelId>10</base:channelId>
               <base:applicationId>SAP</base:applicationId>
               <base:applicationUserId>SMNAIK1</base:applicationUserId>
            </base:sender>
         </base:header>
         <v1:event eventId="78934578935">
            <v1:eventType>RefundProcessed</v1:eventType>
            <v1:eventTime>{{currentDateTime2}}</v1:eventTime>
         </v1:event>
         <v1:orderPayload orderId="{{OrderId}}">
            <!--Sucess Scenario-->
            <v1:orderPayment>
               <v1:creditCardPayment>
                  <!--Refund Amount-->
                  <v1:chargeAmount currencyCode="USD">{{authorizationAmount}}</v1:chargeAmount>
               </v1:creditCardPayment>
               <v1:specificationGroup>
                  <!--Original vesta payment id-->
                  <v1:specificationValue name="originalReceivedPaymentId">{{receivedPaymentId}}</v1:specificationValue>
               </v1:specificationGroup>
               <v1:receivedPaymentId>{{receivedPaymentId}}</v1:receivedPaymentId>
               
            </v1:orderPayment>
            <!--Sucess Scenario-->
            </v1:orderPayload>
      </v1:notifyIncomingEventRequest>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

request.description:
## Reserve eSIM Endpoint

This endpoint allows users to reserve an eSIM for a specific device. It is particularly useful for managing eSIM profiles and ensuring that the correct eSIM is allocated to the desired device.

### Request

**Method:** POST  
**URL:** `https://dtiisr-esimmanagement-reserve-esim-v1.{{ESP}}.npe.tedge.adn-gw.t-mobile.com/devicemanagement/v1/reserve-esim`

#### Request Body

The request body should be in JSON format and include the following parameters:

- **brandId** (string): The identifier for the brand associated with the eSIM. For example, "TMO".
    
- **serialNumber** (string): The serial number of the device for which the eSIM is being reserved. This should be replaced with the actual device identifier (e.g., `{{device1_EID}}`).
    
- **overrideProfile** (boolean): A flag indicating whether to override the existing profile for the device. Set to `false` to maintain the current profile.
    

**Example Request Body:**

``` json
{
  "brandId": "TMO",
  "serialNumber": "{{device1_EID}}",
  "overrideProfile": false
}

 ```

### Response

The response from this endpoint will typically include information about the success or failure of the eSIM reservation process. The structure of the response may vary based on the outcome of the request but generally includes the following:

- **status** (string): Indicates whether the reservation was successful or if an error occurred.
    
- **message** (string): Provides additional details or error messages related to the reservation status.
    
- **data** (object): Contains any relevant data returned from the reservation process, which may include the reserved eSIM details.
    

By following this structure, users can effectively reserve eSIMs for their devices and handle the responses accordingly.

{throw new Error("username/password for Auth Token are incorrect.");}
{throw new Error(`Auth Token Error: Issue with Token URL : ${tokenUrl}`);}
throw new Error("Auth Token Error: Check Console Logs. , open console by CTRL+ALT+C");
console.log(`‚ùå resourceStatus is not AA. Retrying... Attempt #${retryCount}`);
throw new Error("ReserveSIM resourceStatus did not become 'AA' after 5 retries. Stopping collection run.");
// Also add serialNumber & IMSI to Perf_SIM_List
console.log("‚úÖ Added to Perf_SIM_List:", responseJson.serialNumber, responseJson.imsi);

request.description:
## Reserve eSIM Endpoint

This endpoint allows users to reserve an eSIM for a specific device. It is particularly useful for managing eSIM profiles and ensuring that the correct eSIM is allocated to the desired device.

### Request

**Method:** POST  
**URL:** `https://dtiisr-esimmanagement-reserve-esim-v1.{{ESP}}.npe.tedge.adn-gw.t-mobile.com/devicemanagement/v1/reserve-esim`

#### Request Body

The request body should be in JSON format and include the following parameters:

- **brandId** (string): The identifier for the brand associated with the eSIM. For example, "TMO".
    
- **serialNumber** (string): The serial number of the device for which the eSIM is being reserved. This should be replaced with the actual device identifier (e.g., `{{device1_EID}}`).
    
- **overrideProfile** (boolean): A flag indicating whether to override the existing profile for the device. Set to `false` to maintain the current profile.
    

**Example Request Body:**

``` json
{
  "brandId": "TMO",
  "serialNumber": "{{device1_EID}}",
  "overrideProfile": false
}

 ```

### Response

The response from this endpoint will typically include information about the success or failure of the eSIM reservation process. The structure of the response may vary based on the outcome of the request but generally includes the following:

- **status** (string): Indicates whether the reservation was successful or if an error occurred.
    
- **message** (string): Provides additional details or error messages related to the reservation status.
    
- **data** (object): Contains any relevant data returned from the reservation process, which may include the reserved eSIM details.
    

By following this structure, users can effectively reserve eSIMs for their devices and handle the responses accordingly.
